'Adolescent'

The adolescent stage of life, typically defined as the period between puberty and adulthood, spans from around 13 to 19 years of age. During this stage, individuals are undergoing significant physical, emotional, and social changes, which can make them more prone to impulsive and risky behavior. As a result, adolescents are more likely to engage in criminal behavior, particularly during their early teenage years.

However, as they enter their late teenage years, adolescents often gain more control over their emotions and impulses, and are better able to make rational decisions. This makes them more likely to successfully reform and avoid committing crimes in the future.

Therefore, among the ages, I believe that the adolescent stage of life is the most likely to produce a reformed prisoner who will never commit a crime again.
